alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:12AM EST until January 10 at 7:19PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg affecting Stafford, City of Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania independent cities. For the Rappahannock River...including Fredericksburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water covers the Riverside Trail off River Road upstream of Fredericksburg. Water also enters a building at a riverside wedding venue, and begins to cover the parking lot at the Motts Run boat landing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.2 feet, or 0.8 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 13.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 04/10/1918. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Thu Thu Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 12.2 Wed 10 am 11.2 9.0 7.3 13.1 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EST.
